Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by President Bush , two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: "Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. Mike Pence denounced such tactics after the campaign, writing in an essay titled "Confessions of a Negative Campaigner" that "negative campaigning, I now know, is wrong." It is wrong, quite simply, to squander a candidate's priceless moment in history, a moment in which he or she could have brought critical issues before the citizenry, on partisan bickering, Mike Pence wrote in 1991. That same year, Mike Pence became president of the Indiana Policy Review Foundation, a conservative think tank based in Fort Wayne. After years as a radio talk show host
